page.title: 01INTRODUCING PONTELAND
page.content: {Ponteland}started off as a little country village.Over the years Ponteland has got bigger.It got its name Ponteland from the River Pont which runs through a large park in the village.Most of the people who live in Ponteland are commuters who work in {Newcastle}nine miles away.There are a lot of schools in Ponteland: three first schools,two middle schools and one high school.Ponteland has many facilities available to its residents such as a sports centre.It has its own {Ponteland Village Childrens {Association}which does a lot for the children,such as discos,film shows,trips to the beach and even to France. There is also an{Airport}which serves the{Tyneside}area.There is a lot of agricultural land around Ponteland and a small mart which sells sheep,cows and pigs.
